materials: RED HEART® Baby Hugs™ Medium, Art. E404 Oeko-Tex Certified 100% Acrylic baby yarn available in solid color 4.5 oz (127 g), 247 yd (225 m) balls; multis 4 oz (113 g), 208 yd (190 m) balls
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work direction in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: About 8½" long (from top neck band edge to bottom point) x 9" wide (at widest point) [21 cm x 23 cm]
gauge: 12 sc and 14 rows sc = 4" [10 cm]. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
NECK RIBBING
Ch 4 (5, 5).
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across; turn—3 (4, 4) sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in back loop of each sc across; turn.
Rows 3-45 (51, 54): Repeat Row 2. At end of last Row, do not turn; fasten off.
BIB
Row 1 (Right Side): Skip first 15 (17, 17) side Rows of Ribbing and join yarn. Ch 1, sc in same side Row, 2 sc in next side Row, sc in next 13 (15, 17) side Rows; turn—16 (18, 20) sc.
Rows 2-5 (2-7, 2-8): Ch 1, sc in first sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in remaining sc across; turn—20 (24, 27) sc.
Rows 6-10 (8-12, 9-14): Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Rows 11-28 (13-34, 15-39): Ch 1, sc in first sc, sc2tog, sc in remaining sc across; turn—2 (2, 2) sc.
Row 29 (35, 40): Ch 1, sc2tog; fasten off.
ASSEMBLY
Seam beginning and ending Neck Ribbing Rows together. Weave in all ends.

abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Shawl is 18” wide x 56” long.
gauge: 15 sts = 4”; 12 rows = 4” in pattern stitch. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
NOTE: Beginning ch 3 counts as a dc throughout. Shawl is worked from center out to edges.
Special Abbreviations
Shell: 5 dc in ch-3 space.
Picot Shell: (Dc, [dc, ch 3, slip st in dc] 3 times, dc) all in same ch-3 space.

SHAWL
First Half
Ch 65.
Row 1: (Wrong Side): Dc in 4th ch from hook, dc in next ch, *ch 3, skip 2 ch, sc in next 3 ch, ch 3, skip 2 ch, dc in next 3 ch; repeat from * across—21 dc, 18 sc, and 12 ch-3 spaces.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in each dc, *ch 3, dc in each sc, ch 3, sc in each dc; repeat from * across—21 sc, 18 dc, and 12 ch-3 spaces.
Row 3: Ch 3, turn, skip first sc, dc in next 2 sc, *ch 3, sc in each dc, ch 3, dc in each sc; repeat from * across.
Row 4-60: Repeat Rows 2-3, end with Row 2.
Shawl measures 20”. Do Not Fasten Off.

Border
Row 1: Ch 1, turn, sc in first st, ch 2, Shell in ch-3 space, *ch 2, skip next st, sc in next st, skip next st, ch 2, Shell in ch-3 space; repeat from * across, ch 2, sc in last st—12 Shells.
Row 2: Ch 5 (counts as dc and ch 2), turn, sc in 3rd dc of Shell, *ch 2, dc in sc, ch 2, sc in 3rd dc of Shell; repeat from * across, ch 2, dc in last sc—24 ch-2 spaces.
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, sc in first st, sc in ch-2 space, *ch 3, sc in next ch-2 space; repeat from * across working last sc in beginning ch-space, sc in 3rd ch of beginning ch-5—23 ch-3 spaces.
Row 4: Ch 1, turn, sc in first st, ch 2, Shell in next ch-3 space, *ch 2, sc in next ch-3 space, ch 2, Shell in next ch-3 space; repeat from * across, ch 2, sc in last st—12 Shells.
Row 5-12: Repeat Rows 2-4 twice, then Rows 2-3 once.
Row 13: Turn, Slip st in first st, ch 2, Picot Shell in next ch-3 space, *ch 2, slip st in next ch-3 space, ch 2, Picot Shell in next ch-3 space; repeat from * across, ch 2, slip st in last st—12 Picot Shells.
Fasten off.
Shawl measures 28”.

Second Half
Row 1: With right side facing and working along opposite side of foundation ch, join yarn in first ch with a slip st, ch 3, dc in next 2 ch, *ch 3, skip 2 ch, sc in next 3 ch, ch 3, skip 2 ch, dc in next 3 ch; repeat from * across.
Work as for First Half of Shawl.

FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Baby Blanket™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m)
Main Color (MC) Lemon Lime (04223) 4 balls or 777 yds/711 m
Contrast A White (04005) 1 ball or 21 yds/19 m
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2(4)tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 (4) stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 11" [28 cm] diameter x 20" [51 cm] tall, excluding Tail and Toes.
gauge: 7.5 sc and 7 rows = 4" [10 cm] with 2 strands of yarn held tog.
instructions:
BASE 
Note: Join each rnd with sl st to first sc.
With 2 strands of MC held tog, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 32 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 48 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 56 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 64 sc.
9th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 72 sc.
10th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Place marker at end of rnd.
11th rnd: Ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Rep last rnd until work from marked rnd measures 12" [30.5 cm]. On last rnd, place marker on 54th st to mark beg of Dome. Place markers on 28th, 35th and 42nd sts to mark tooth placement. Fasten off.
DOMED OPENING
With RS facing, join 2 strands of MC with sl st to marker indicating 54th st of rnd.
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in same st as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 35 sts. Turn. 36 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog. (1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sc2tog) 3 times. 1 sc in each of last 5 sc. Turn. 32 sc.
3rd and alt RS rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog) twice. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc) twice. Turn. 28 sc.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc) 4 times. Turn. 24 sc.
8th row: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog) twice. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) twice. Turn. 20 sc.
10th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) 3 times. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. Turn. 16 sc.
12th row: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog) twice. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Turn. 12 sc.
14th row: Ch 1. (1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog) twice. (Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc) twice. Turn. 8 sc.
15th row: (RS). Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 4 times. Turn. 4 sc.
16th row: Ch 1. Sc4tog. Turn.
Edging rnd: Ch 1. Work sc evenly down edge of Dome to last st on Dome. Work sc2tog over last st of Dome and first st of Basket opening. Work sc evenly across Basket opening to last st on opening. Work sc2tog over last st of Basket opening and first st of Dome. Work sc evenly up rem sts on Dome. Do not fasten off.
Finish with invisible join: Cut MC, leaving a long yarn tail. Pull loop on hook up until tail passes through last st (no loops rem on hook). Thread yarn tail onto yarn needle. Insert needle under top 2 loops of next st from front to back. Insert needle through back loop only of last st worked, from front to back. Pull gently to close gap and make yarn tail look like st.
TAIL
Note: Tail is worked in spiral. Do not join rnds. Place marker on first st to mark beg of rnd, moving marker up each rnd.
With 2 strands of MC, ch 20. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. 20 sc.
2nd and 3rd rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
4th rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. 16 sc.
5th to 7th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
8th rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 12 sc.
9th to 11th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
12th rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 8 sc.
13th rnd: *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 4 sc. Fasten off, leaving long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts.
SPIKES (make 3)
With 2 strands of MC, ch 7.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 6 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 4 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice. Turn. 2 sc.
4th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Turn. 1 sc.
Edging rnd: Ch 1. Work sc evenly around edges of Spikes, working 3 sc in each corner. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off, leaving long end.
TOES
Note: There is a ch-4 between 2 sets of 3 Toes.
1st row: (RS). With 1 strand of MC, **ch 5. Working into back bumps of ch, 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in next ch** — Toe made. Rep from ** to ** twice more. Ch 4. Rep from ** to ** 3 times. Do not turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. Work sc evenly along straight edge (sides of dc sts) of 3 Toes. 1 sc in each of next 4 ch. Work sc evenly along straight edge of rem 3 Toes. Fasten off, leaving long end.
HANDS (make 2)
With 1 strand of MC, ch 6.
1st row: (RS). Working into back bumps of chain, 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each of next 2 ch. 1 dc in each of last 2 ch. Fasten off, leaving long end.
TEETH
Bottom Teeth: **With RS facing, join 2 strands of A with sl st along Basket opening at sc above first marker (28th st).
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in same st as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Turn. 4 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice. Turn. 2 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Fasten off.**
Rep from ** to ** at sc above rem markers (35th st and 42nd st).
Top Teeth: Rep from ** to ** along Domed edge twice, centering placement of each Tooth between Bottom Teeth (see picture).
FINISHING
Stuff Tail. Sew Tail, Spikes, Toes and Hands to Basket, as shown in picture.

instructions:
COZY
With A, ch 94 (106, 116).
Row 1: Dc in 4th ch from hook, crossing over previous st, dc in 3rd ch from hook (first cross st made), *skip next ch, dc in next ch, crossing over previous st, dc in previous skipped ch (cross st made); repeat from * across to last ch, dc in last ch – 45 (51, 57) cross sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in each dc across – 92 (104, 116) sc.
Row 3: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), turn, *skip next sc, dc in next sc, dc in previous skipped sc; repeat from * across to last sc, dc in last st – 92 (104, 116) dc; 45 (51, 57) cross sts and 2 dc. 
Row 4: Ch 1, turn, *sc in next 10 (11, 13) dc, 2 sc in next dc; repeat from * across to last 3 (7, 3) sts, sc in last 3 (7, 3) dc – 100 (112, 124) sc. 
Row 5: Repeat Row 3 – 100 (112, 124) dc; 49 (55, 61) cross sts and 2 dc. 
Row 6: Repeat Row 2. 
Row 7: Repeat Row 3.
Row 8: Ch 1, turn, *sc in next 11 (12, 14) dc, 2 sc in next dc; repeat from * across to last 3 (7, 3) sts, sc in each sc – 108 (120, 132) sc. 
Row 9: Repeat Row 3 – 108 (120, 132) dc; 53 (59, 65) cross sts and 2 dc. 
Row 10: Repeat Row 2. 
Row 11: Repeat Row 3.
Row 12: Repeat Row 2. 
Rows 13-14: With B, ch 1, turn, sc in each sc.
Row 15: Ch 3, turn, *skip next sc, dc in next sc, dc in previous skipped sc; repeat from * across to last sc, dc in last st – 108 (120, 132) dc; 53 (59, 65) cross sts and 2 dc. 
Row 16: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc.
Row 17: With A, ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
With right sides together, fold Cozy in half crosswise. 
Working through both layers, join A in lower edge, sc along edges of rows to join short ends together. 
Round 1 (Wrong Side): Ch 1, turn to work opposite foundation ch, sc in each ch around, slip st in first st to join – 92 (104, 116) sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, *sc in next 8 (9, 10) sc, skip next sc; repeat from * around to last 1 (3, 5) sc, sc in last 1 (3, 5) sc, slip st in first sc – 82 (94, 106) sc.
Fasten off.
Weave in ends.

Motif

1st rnd: Ch 3. 2 dc in ring. (Ch 3. 3 dc in ring) 3 times. Ch 3. Join with sl st to top of ch-3.

4th rnd: Join A with sl st to any ch-3 corner sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in same ch-3 sp as last sl st. *(Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp) twice. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more. (Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp) twice. Ch 1. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. Fasten off.

Motif 2: Make 4 using D as Color 1 and B as Color 2.

Motif 4: Make 4 using F as Color 1 and C as Color 2.
Motif 5: Make 3 using C as Color 1 and E as Color 2.
Motif 6: Make 3 using B as Color 1 and F as Color 2.

RATTLE
Note: Add stuffing as you go.
With A, create an adjustable ring.
Round 1: 6 sc in ring (pull tail of yarn); do NOT join but work in continuous rounds. Place marker in first sc of next round and move up each round – 6 sc.
Round 2: [Inc] 6 times – 12 sc.
Round 3: [Inc, sc in next sc] 6 times – 18 sc.
Rounds 4-6: Sc in each sc around.
Round 7: [Sc in next sc, dec] 6 times – 12 sc.
Round 8: [Sc in next 2 sc, dec] 3 times – 9 sc.
Rounds 9-18: Sc in each sc around.
Round 19: [Inc] 9 times – 18 sc.
Round 20: [Inc, sc in next 2 sc] 6 times – 24 sc.
Round 21: [Inc, sc in next 3 sc] 6 times – 30 sc.
Round 22: [Inc, sc in next 4 sc] 6 times – 36 sc.
Round 23: [Inc, sc in next 5 sc] 6 times – 42 sc.

Round 29: [Sc in next 5 sc, dec] 6 times – 36 sc.
Round 30: [Sc in next 4 sc, dec] 6 times – 30 sc.
Round 31: [Sc in next 3 sc, dec] 6 times – 24 sc.
Round 32: [Sc in next 2 sc, dec] 6 times – 18 sc. Add stuffing and bell.
Round 33: Sc in each sc around.
Round 34: [Sc in next sc, dec] 6 times – 12 sc. Finish stuffing rattle firmly.
Round 35: [dec] 6 times; join with a slip st in next sc – 6 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail. With yarn needle, weave tail through remaining sts and pull tight. Weave in ends.

Eye
With B, create an adjustable ring.
Round 1: 6 sc in ring (pull tail of yarn); join with a slip st in first st – 6 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, [inc] 6 times; join in first sc – 12 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in each sc around changing to C in last sc; join.

Rounds 5-7: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join. Fasten off, leaving a long tail.
FINISHING
Add stuffing to eye. With yarn needle, sew eye to rattle between Rounds 27 – 35. Weave in ends. With B, embroider a mouth diagonally on Round 23.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (Solids: 2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m; Ombres: 2 oz/56.7 g; 95 yds/86 m)
Contrast A Ecru (00004) 6 balls or 720 yds/655 m
Contrast B Coral Seas Ombre (02750) 3 balls or 168 yds/153 m
Contrast C Tangerine (01699) 2 balls or 144 yds/131 m
Contrast D Country Red (01530) 2 balls or 132 yds/120 m
Sizes U.S. F/5 (3.75 mm) and U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hooks or sizes needed to obtain gauges.
abbreviations: Sc2(3)tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 (3) stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: Approx 10" [25.5 cm] diameter x 12" [30.5 cm] high.
gauge: Basket: 12 sc and 13 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook and holding 2 strands of yarn together. Toadstool: 16 sc and 17 rows = 4" [10 cm] with smaller hook and single strand of yarn.
instructions:
BASKET
Base: With 2 strands of A and larger hook, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in next sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 18 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 30 sc.

6th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 36 sc.
7th to 15th rnds: Cont in this manner, inc 6 sc evenly around each rnd. 90 sc.
16th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st in first sc.
17th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, *2 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 21 sc. Rep from * around to last 2 sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 94 sc. Place marker at end of last rnd.
Main Section: Next rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as hdc). 1 hdc in same sp as last sl st. 1 hdc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
Next rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as hdc). *1 hdc in sp between next 2 hdc. Rep from * around, ending with 1 hdc in sp between last hdc and first hdc of rnd. Join with sl st to first hdc. 94 hdc.
Rep last rnd until work from marked rnd measures 9½" [24.5 cm]. Join 2 strands of B at end of last rnd. Break A. With 2 strands of B, rep last rnd 3 times more.
Make handles: Next rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as hdc). (1 hdc in sp between next 2 hdc) 6 times. *Ch 18. Skip next 18 sps between 2 hdc.* (1 hdc in sp between next 2 hdc) 29 times. Rep from * to * once more. **1 hdc in sp between next 2 hdc. Rep from ** around, ending with 1 hdc in sp between last hdc and first hdc of rnd. Join with sl st to first hdc.
Next rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as hdc). (1 hdc in sp between next 2 hdc) 6 times. Work 18 hdc in next ch-18 sp. (1 hdc in sp between next 2 hdc) 29 times. Work 18 hdc in next ch-18 sp. *1 hdc in sp between next 2 hdc. Rep from * around, ending with 1 hdc in sp between last hdc and first hdc of rnd. Join with sl st to first hdc. 94 hdc.
Next rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as hdc). *1 hdc in sp between next 2 hdc. Rep from * around, ending with 1 hdc in sp between last hdc and first hdc of rnd. Join with sl st to first hdc. Fasten off.

TOADSTOOL (Make 12)
Toadstool Cap
See diagram on page 3.
With C, ch 16.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 15 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each st to last 3 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in last sc. 13 sts.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
4th to 7th rows: As 2nd row. 5 sc.
8th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sc3tog. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 3 sts.
9th row: Ch 1. Sc3tog. Fasten off.
Join D.
Edging rnd: With D, ch 1. Work evenly in sc around entire Cap, working 3 sc in each corner sp. Join. Fasten off.

Toadstool Stem
See diagram on page 3.
With D, ch 6.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd chain from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 5 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc) twice. 7 sc.
4th row: As 2nd row.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. (Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc) twice. 5 sts.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. Sc3tog. 1 sc in last st. Turn. 3 sts.
7th row: As 2nd row.
8th row: Ch 1. Sc3tog. Fasten off.
Join C.
Edging rnd: With C, ch 1. Work in sc evenly around entire Stem, working 3 sc in each corner. Join. Fasten off.

Toadstool Spots
See diagrams on page 3.
Small Spot (make 2)
With D, beg using magic loop method demonstrated here.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 6 sc in ring. Join. Fasten off.
Large Spot (make 1)
With D, make magic loop.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 8 sc in ring. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. Sl st in each sc around. Join. Fasten off.
Sew Spots to Toadstool Cap as shown in photo. Align Toadstool Cap and Stem and sew in place as shown in photo.

FINISHING
With D, sew Toadstools evenly, but randomly placed around Main Section of Basket as shown in photo.

pattern_name: Gnome for the Holidays Wine Bottle Cozy
materials: Bernat® Handicrafter® Holidays (80 g/2.8 oz; 126 m/138 yds)
Bernat Handicrafter® Cotton (50 g/1.75 oz; 73 m/80 yds)
Size 5 mm (U.S. H/8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
abbreviations: Loop = Insert hook into stitch. Wrap yarn around finger and pull up a loop. Keeping finger in place, yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook.
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: To fit 0.75L wine bottle.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: When joining new color, work to last 2 loops on hook of first color. Draw new color through last 2 loops and proceed.
With MC, ch 15, then with B, ch 18. 
1st row: (RS). With B, 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 16 ch. With MC, 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 32 sc.
2nd row: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Loop in each of next 14 sts. (Loops will appear on RS). With B, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 17 sc. With MC, 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows until work from beg measures 6" [15 cm], ending on a 2nd row.
Make ‘Face’: Next row: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 17 sc. With MC, 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. Do not break MC. Join C. With C, 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. Do not break C. With MC, 1 sc in each of last 5 sts. Turn.
Next row: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Loop in each of next 3 sc. With C, 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. With MC, Loop in each of next 4 sc. With B, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Next row: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 17 sc. With MC, 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. With C, 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 4 times in next st. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – Bobble made (nose). 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. With MC, 1 sc in each of last 4 sc. Turn.
Next row: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Loop in each of next 2 sc. With C, 1 sc in each of next 9 sts. With MC, Loop in each of next 3 sc. With B, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Next row: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 17 sc. With MC, 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. With C, 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. With MC, 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. Turn.
Next row: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Loop in each of next 4 sc. With C, 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Break C. With MC, Loop in each of next 5 sc. With B, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Next row: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 17 sc. With MC, 1 sc in each of next 15 sc. Fasten off.
Sew side seams tog.
HAT
With A, ch 40. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring, taking care to not twist ch.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first sc. 40 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sts.
Join Hat to Gnome: 1st rnd: Align Hat over Gnome Body, having Hat on outside. With A, ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sts.
4th and 5th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 16 sts.
7th and 8th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
9th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sts.
10th to 13th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Fasten off at end of 13th rnd.
FINISHING
Sew black beads to Face for eyes as shown in picture. With red embroidery floss, embroider mouth using outline st.

instructions:
BLOCK BASE
With MC, ch 22.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 
1 sc in each ch to end of chain.

end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until 30 rows total 
have been worked.
Fasten off.
LLAMA
Head
With A, ch 16.
See diagram on page 2.
1st row: 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 
1 hdc in each ch to last ch. 5 hdc in 
last ch. Working into opposite side 
of foundation ch, 1 hdc in each ch 
to end of ch. Turn. 31 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of 
first 13 hdc. 2 hdc in each of next 
5 hdc. 1 hdc in each of last 13 hdc. 
Turn. 36 hdc.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 
12 hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. (1 dc 
in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc) 
5 times. 1 hdc in next hdc. 1 sc in 
each of last 12 hdc. Turn. 41 sts.
4th row: Skip first 2 sc. *5 dc in 
next st. Skip next st. Sl st in next 
st. Rep from * to end of row. Fasten 
off.

Sew Head to Block Base as shown 
in photo, leaving ruffle edges free.
Ears (make 2)
With A, ch 7.
1st row: 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 
1 hdc in each ch to last ch. (1 hdc. 
1 dc. Ch 2. 1 dc. 1 hdc) all in last 
ch. Working into opposite side of 
foundation ch, 1 hdc in each ch to 
end of ch. Fasten off.
Sew Ears behind ruffle edge of 
Head. Attach at base of Ears.
Nose
Note: Join rnds with sl st to first 
hdc.
With A, ch 5.
1st rnd:  2 hdc in 3rd ch from 
hook. 1 hdc in next ch. 5 hdc in 
last ch. Working into opposite side 
of foundation ch, 1 hdc in next ch. 
3 hdc in last ch. Join. 12 hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each of first 
2 hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in 
each of next 5 hdc. 1 hdc in next 
hdc. 2 hdc in each of last 3 hdc. 
Join. 22 hdc.
Fasten off.
Sew Nose to Head as shown in 
photo.
With 2 strands of MC, embroider 
‘rope’ on Llama’s neck using chain 
stitch.
With B, embroider eyes and nose 
as shown in photo.
CHAIN STITCH EMBROIDERY

measurements: Hat measures 24” (61 cm) circumference at brim.
instructions:
HAT
Ch 5; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 2 (counts as first hdc here and throughout), 7 hdc in ring; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—8 hdc.
Round 2: Ch 2, hdc in same st as join, 2 hdc in each remaining st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—16 hdc.
Round 3: Ch 2, hdc in same st as join, *hdc in next st, 2 hdc in next st; repeat from * around to last st, hdc in last st; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—24 hdc.
Round 4: Ch 2, hdc in same st as join, *hdc in next 2 sts, 2 hdc in next st; repeat from * 6 times, hdc in last 2 sts, join with slip st in top of beginning ch—32 hdc.
Round 5: Ch 2, hdc in same st as join, *hdc in next 3 sts, 2 hdc in next st; repeat from * 6 times, hdc in last 3 sts; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—40 hdc.
Round 6: Ch 2, hdc in same st as join, *hdc next 4 sts, 2 hdc in next st; repeat from * 6 times, hdc in last 4 sts; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—48 hdc.
Round 7: Ch 2, hdc in same st as join, *hdc next 5 sts, 2 hdc in next st; repeat from * 6 times, hdc in last 6 sts; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—56 hdc.
Round 8: Ch 2, hdc in same st as join, hdc in next 6 sts, *2 hdc in next st, hdc next 6 sts; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—64 hdc.
Round 9: Ch 2, hdc in same st as join, hdc in next 7 sts, *2 hdc in next st, hdc next 7 sts; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—72 hdc.
Rounds 10–12: Ch 2, hdc in each st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch.
Round 13: Ch 2, hdc in next 5 sts, hdc2tog, *hdc in next 6 sts, hdc2tog; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—63 hdc.
Round 14: Ch 2, *skip next st, 3 hdc in next st, skip next st, hdc in next st; repeat from * 14 times, skip next st, 3 hdc in next st; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—Sixteen 3-hdc groups.
Rounds 15–17: Ch 2, *skip next st, 3 hdc in next st (center st of 3-hdc group), skip next st, hdc in next st; repeat from * around to last 3 sts, skip next st, 3 hdc in st, skip last st; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—Sixteen 3-hdc groups.
Ch 2, 2 hdc in same st as join, *skip next st, 3 hdc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—Thirty-two 3-hdc groups.
Rounds 19–21: Slip st in next st (center st of first 3-hdc groups), ch 2, 2 hdc in same st *skip next 2 sts, 3 hdc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch. Do not fasten off. Continue in rows.
Flap
Row 1: Slip st in next st (center st of first 3-hdc groups), ch 2, 2 hdc in same st, *skip next 2 sts, 3 hdc in next st; repeat from * 3 times, turn—Five 3-hdc groups.
Rows 2–6: Slip st in next st (center st of first 3-hdc groups), ch 2, 2 hdc in same st, *skip next 2 sts, 3 hdc in next st; repeat from * across to last st; leave last st unworked, turn.
FINISHING
Cut 3 strands each measuring 6” (15 cm). Using photograph as a guide, turn brim to right side and position flap with upper point towards crown and lower point aligned with folded edge of brim or as desired. Position button on flap. With strand on yarn needle, insert needle down in buttonhole through all thicknesses to wrong side and then up through other buttonhole so that ends of yarn are on right side. Tie ends in a knot and trim to desired length. Repeat to attach remaining buttons. Optional Apply a drop of fabric sealant to the knots to prevent unraveling.
Weave in ends.

materials: Small crochet hook or large-eyed tapestry needle
abbreviations: ch = chain; dc = double crochet; sc = single crochet; st(s) = stitch(es); tr = treble (triple) crochet; yo = yarn over hook; ( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st; [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified; * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated. Special Stitches beg tr cl (beginning treble crochet cluster) (worked over 4 stitches) = Ch 3, *yo twice, insert hook in next stitch, yo and draw up a loop, [yo and draw through 2 loops on hook] twice; repeat from * 3 more times, yo and draw through all 5 loops on hook. picot = Ch 2, sc in back bar of second ch from hook. tr cl (treble crochet cluster) (worked over 5 stitches) = Yo twice, insert hook in first stitch, yo and draw up a loop, [yo and draw through 2 loops on hook] twice, *yo twice, insert hook in next st, yo and draw up a loop, [yo and draw through 2 loops on hook] twice; repeat from * 3 more times, yo and draw through all 6 loops on hook. Special Technique Adjustable-ring = Wrap yarn into a ring, ensuring that the tail falls behind the working yarn. Grip ring and tail firmly between middle finger and thumb. Insert hook through center of ring, yarn over (with working yarn) and draw up a loop. Work stitches of first round in the ring. After the first round of stitches is worked, pull gently, but firmly, on tail to tighten ring.

instructions:
RUG
Make an adjustable ring. Round 1 (right side): Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), 15 dc in ring; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3 – 16 dc. Round 2: Ch 6 (counts as first dc and ch 3), skip next dc, *dc in next dc, ch 3, skip next dc; repeat from * around; join with slip st to 3rd ch of beginning ch-6 – 8 dc, 8 ch-3 spaces. Round 3: Slip st in first ch-3 space, ch 3, 4 dc in same ch-3 space, 5 dc in each ch-3 space; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3 – 40 dc. Round 4: Ch 3, dc in next 4 dc, *ch 3, dc in next 5 dc; repeat from * around, ch 3; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3 – 40 dc, 8 ch-3 spaces. Round 5: Beg tr cl, *ch 7, sc in next ch-3 space, ch 7, tr cl; repeat from * around, ch 3, tr in top of beginning ch-3 of beg tr cl – 1 beg tr cl, 8 tr cl, 16 ch-7 spaces, 8 sc. Round 6: Ch 3, 2 dc in first ch-7 space, *ch 3, 5 dc in next ch-7 space, ch 1, 5 dc in next ch-7 space; repeat from * around, ch 1, 2 dc in first ch-7 space; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3 – 80 dc, 8 ch-3 spaces, 8 ch-1 spaces. Round 7: *Ch 7, sc in center dc of next 5-dc cluster; repeat from * around, ch 7, join with slip st to first ch – 16 ch-7 spaces, 15 sc. Round 8: Slip st into first ch-7 space, ch 3, 4 dc in same space, *ch 3, 5 dc in next ch-7 space; repeat from * around, ch 3, join with slip st in top of first ch 3 – 80 dc, 17 ch-3 spaces. Rounds 9-14: Repeat Rounds 7 and 8 – 95 dc, 20 ch-3 spaces at end of Round 14. Round 15: Ch 3, 4 dc in same dc as joining, skip next dc, sc in next dc, *(sc, picot, sc) in next ch-3 space, sc in next dc, skip next dc, 5 dc in next dc, skip next dc, sc in next dc; repeat from * around to last ch-3 space, (sc, picot, sc) in last ch-3 space; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3 – 20 (sc, picot, sc) groups, 95 dc, 37 sc. Fasten off. FINISHING With small crochet hook or large-eyed tapestry needle, weave in ends.

materials: Worsted Gauge Yarn (as supplied in kit)

abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.

instructions:
Notes:
• Worked in continuous rnds, do not join at end of rnd.
• Move marker as work progresses to first st of each rnd.
• Working with Stitch Markers.
• The workings of a crochet stitch.
SNOWFLAKE
Snowflake Back
Make magic loop. See diagram on page 2.
*1st rnd: (RS). Ch 1. 6 sc in loop. PM on first st. Pull magic loop tight, do not join.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. 18 sc.
4th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.* Sl st in next sc and fasten off. Fasten off.

CROCHET I SKILL LEVEL: EASY

CROCHET AMIGURUMI SNOWFLAKE ORNAMENT 2 of 2

SNOWFLAKE POINT
Snowflake Front
Work from * to * as given for Snowflake Back, do not fasten off.
Hold Snowflake Front and Back WS tog with sl st of Snowflake Back aligned with next st of Snowflake Front.
Snowflake Points
Notes:
• Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
• Working in rounds.
First Point:
Working into sts on both Snowflake Front and Back as follows:
**1st rnd: 1 sc in each of next 3 sc of Snowflake Front. Turn work so Snowflake Back is facing, work 1 sc in each of next 3 sc aligned with 3 sts of Snowflake Front. Join. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. 6 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 3 sc in next sc) twice. Join. 10 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc) twice. Join. 12 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 6 times. Join.
Stuff Snowflake Point lightly.
6th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 3 times. Join.
Fasten off, leaving long tail. Using long tail, weave through tops of sts in last rnd and pull tight to close.**
Second to Fifth Points: Join yarn with sl st to next unworked sc of Snowflake Front. Ch 1. Beg in same sp as sl st, work from ** to ** as given for First Point.
Rep Second Point 3 times more – 5 Snowflake Points made.
Stuff Snowflake lightly.
Sixth Point: Work as given for Second Point for Sixth Snowflake Point – 6 Snowflake Points total.
With yarn needle, whip stitch Snowflake Front and Back tog in sps between each Snowflake Point.
Weave in all ends.
Hanging Loop
Cut a strand of yarn 5" [12.5 cm] long. Fold strand in half and tie ends to form Hanging Loop. Pull Hanging Loop halfway through top of one Snowflake Point then pull Loop through itself and tighten to secure.
Alternate: With yarn needle, pass yarn through top of one Snowflake Point and base of provided Keychain Clasp. Whipstitch and tie securely as close to top of Snowflake Point as possible and weave in ends.
Face
Split black yarn into 2 plies and embroider face on Snowflake Front, as shown, using French Knots for eyes and Straight Stitch for mouth.

Lower Section

First Block
Row 3: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), dc in next 3 sts; leave remaining stitches unworked, turn—4 dc.
Rows 4 and 5: Ch 3, dc in each st, turn. Remove hook and place stitch on marker.
2nd Block
Row 3 (right side): With right side facing, join C with slip st in first unworked st of Row 3 of first side, ch 3, dc in each unworked st, turn—4 dc.
Rows 4 and 5: Ch 3, dc in each st, turn.
Upper Section

The instructions are written for size 4/6. If changes are necessary for larger size(s) the instructions will be written 4/6 (8/10). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes.

SKIRT
Large Granny Squares
See diagram on page 5.
Square I – Make 3
Color 1: D
Color 2: B
Color 3: C
Color 4: E
Square II - Make 3
Color 1: B
Color 2: D
Color 3: E
Color 4: C
Square III - Make 3 ( 4)
Color 1: E
Color 2: C
Color 3: B
Color 4: D
Square IV - Make 3 ( 4)
Color 1: C
Color 2: E
Color 3: D
Color 4: B
Square V - Make 3 ( 4)
Color 1: E
Color 2: B
Color 3: D
Color 4: C

Notes:
• Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc.
• Ch 6 at beg of rnds counts as dc and ch-3 sp.
• Join all rnds with sl st to 3rd ch of ch-6 unless otherwise indicated.
**With Color 1, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring. See diagram on page 5.
1st rnd:  (RS). Ch 6. (3 dc in ring. Ch 3) 3 times. 2 dc in ring. Join. Fasten off. 12 dc and 4 ch-3 sps.
2nd rnd:  Join Color 2 in any ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from *twice. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join. Fasten off. 24 dc, 4 ch-1 sps and 4 ch-3 sps.
3rd rnd:  Join Color 3 in any ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. 3 dc in last ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join. Fasten off. 36 dc, 8 ch-1 sps and 4 ch-3 sps.
4th rnd:  Join Color 4 in any ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-2 sp. *(Ch 1. 3 dc) in each ch-1 sp across to next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice. (Ch 1. 3 dc) in each ch-1 sp across to first ch-3 sp. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join. Fasten off. 48 dc, 12 ch-1 sps and 4 ch-3 sps.
5th rnd:  With A, as 4th rnd. 60 dc, 16 ch-1 sps and 4 ch-3 sps. Fasten off.

Sew Squares into 5 ( 6) Strips as shown in Skirt assembly diagram on page 3.

Strip Borders
Left Border
See diagram on page 6.
With RS facing, join A with sl st to corner ch-3 sp at top Left corner of Strip.
1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in same ch-3 sp. Working down side edge of strip, work 1 sc in each st and ch-1 sp to next corner ch-3 sp. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. 1 hdc in next ch-3 sp. Work 1 hdc in each st and ch-1 sp to next corner ch-3 sp. 1 hdc in next ch-3 sp. 1 dc in next ch-3 sp. 1 dc in each st and ch-1 sp to last corner ch-3 sp. 1 dc in last ch-3 sp. Fasten off.

Right Border
See diagram on page 6.
With RS facing, join A with sl st to corner ch-3 sp at bottom Right corner of Strip.
1st row: Ch 3. Working up right side edge of strip, work 1 dc in each st and ch-1 sp to next corner ch-3 sp. 1 dc in next ch-3 sp. 1 hdc in next ch-3 sp. Work 1 hdc in each st and ch-1 sp to next corner ch-3 sp. 1 hdc in next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in each st and ch-1 sp to last corner ch-3 sp. 1 sc in last ch-3 sp. Fasten off.

Join Strips following layout in Skirt Assembly Diagram. Sew Back seam.

Waistband Casing
See diagram on page 6.
Join A with sl st to any ch-3 sp at center back of Skirt.
1st rnd:  Ch 3. Working in front loops only,  work 1 dc in each dc, ch-1, and ch-3 sp around. Join with sl st to first dc.
2nd rnd:  Ch 3. 1 dc in each dc around. Join with sl st to first dc.
3rd rnd:  Ch 3. Working in back loops only,  work 1 dc in each dc around. Join with sl st to first dc.
4th rnd: As 2nd rnd.
Fold Waistband between 2nd and 3rd rnds, ensuring sts are aligned. With WS facing, seam Waistband closed using unworked back loops from 1st rnd. Insert elastic before casing is fully seamed, overlapping ends of elastic, and sewing securely with sewing thread and needle.

BIB
Medium Granny Squares
See diagram on page 5.

Square VI - Make 1 ( 2)
Color 1: D
Color 2: B
Color 3: C

Square VII – Make 1
Color 1: B
Color 2: D
Color 3: E

Square VIII - Make 1 ( 2)
Color 1: E
Color 2: C
Color 3: B

Square IX – Make 1
Color 1: C
Color 2: E
Color 3: D
Work from ** to ** as given for Large Granny Square. Fasten off. Sew Squares tog as shown in Bib Assembly and Attachment Diagram.

Bib Border
With RS facing, join A with sl st to lower right corner ch-3 of Bib.
1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in ch-3 sp. 1 sc in each dc, ch-1 sp and ch-3 sp to top right corner ch-3 sp. 3 sc in corner ch-3 sp. 1 sc in each dc, ch-1 sp, and ch-3 sp to top left corner ch-3 sp. 3 sc in corner ch-3 sp. 1 sc in each dc, ch-1 sp, and ch-3 sp to bottom left corner ch-3 sp. 1 sc in corner ch-3 sp. Fasten off.

Seam Bib to center Front of Skirt as shown in Bib Assembly and Attachment Diagram.

STRAPS
Small Granny Squares
See diagram below.

Square X - Make 2 ( 4)
Color 1: B
Color 2: D

Square XI – Make 4
Color 1: E
Color 2: C

Square XII – Make 2
Color 1: C
Color 2: E

Square XIII – Make 2
Color 1: E
Color 2: B
Work from ** to *** as given for Large Granny Squares. Fasten off. Seam tog as shown in Strap Assembly Diagram.

With RS facing, join D with sl st to top right corner ch-3 sp at Front of Strap.
Work edging along front edge of Strap as follows:
1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in ch-3 sp. 1 sc in each dc and ch-1 sp to next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in ch-3 sp. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Fasten off.

PM at center back of Skirt. Seam 1 Strap to each side of center back marker.
Sew buttons to front of Bib, placed above center of Granny Squares as shown in photo. Note that ch-1 sp between clusters in center of Granny Square will act as buttonhole as shown in photo.

DSL:4ch, ss

Now translate the NL into DSL:

DSL:

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (70.9 g/2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds)
Small amount of Contrast B (01628 Hot Orange) for Nose.
Size 4 mm (U.S. G or 6) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 6" [15 cm] tall.
gauge: 15 sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Body: (make 2 pieces alike for Front and Back).
**With MC, ch 2. 
1st rnd: 7 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 7 sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 14 sc. 
3rd rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) 7 times. Join with sl st to 
first sc. 21 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 7 times. Join with 
sl st to first sc. 28 sc.**
5th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 7 times. Join with 
sl st to first sc. 35 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 7 times. Join with 
sl st to first sc. 42 sc. Fasten off. 
Join front and Back: With WS of Front and Back facing each other, join 
MC with sl st to any sc. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, 1 sc in 
same sp as sl st. (Miss next sc. 3 dc in next sc. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next 
sc) 8 times. Fasten off. 
head: (make 2). Work from ** to ** as given for Body. Fasten off.
Overlap each piece of Head over opening at top of Body and sew in 
position, leaving opening free as shown in photo. 
Scarf: With A, ch 38. 
1st row: 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Fasten 
off. 
fringe: Cut lengths of A 3" [7.5 cm] long. Take 3 strands tog, fold in half 
and knot into fringe at each end of Scarf. Trim fringe evenly.
hat: With A, ch 21. Join with sl st to form a ring, taking care not to twist 
chain. 
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
3rd rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Draw up a loop in each of next 
2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook – sc2tog made) 3 times. 
18 sts rem. 
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
5th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog) 3 times. 15 sts rem. 
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
7th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog) 3 times. 12 sts rem. 
8th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
9th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog) 3 times. 9 sts rem. 
10th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
11th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog) 3 times. 6 sts rem. 
12th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 3 times. 3 sts rem. Fasten off. Break yarn. Thread 
yarn through rem sts pull tightly and fasten securely.
nose: With B, ch 3. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook and next ch. Fasten off.
finiShing
Sew on beads for eyes. Sew Nose in position. Sew 3 buttons to front of 
Body for decoration. Secure center of Scarf at back of Body. Put on Hat 
and tie Scarf to keep opening closed.

DSL:

materials: Caron® Simply Soft® (6 oz /170.1 g; 315 yds/288 m)
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Hdc2(3)tog = Yoh and draw up a loop in each of next 2 (3) stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
Sc2(3)tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 (3) stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: Approximate measurement of items not specified.
gauge: 17 hdc and 12 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnds does not count as a st.

Maki Roll
With A, ch 3.
1st rnd: 10 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first hdc. 10 hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 20 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last st. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 30 hdc.
4th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 40 hdc.
5th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 50 hdc.
6th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. With B, join with sl st to first hdc. 60 hdc.
7th rnd: Ch 2. Working in back loops only, 1 hdc in each st around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
8th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. Rep 8th rnd until work from 7th rnd measures approx 4" [10 cm]. Join A at end of last rnd.
Shape top: Next rnd: With A, ch 2. Working in back loops only, 1 hdc in each of first 4 hdc. *Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog. Join with sl st to first hdc. 50 sts.
Next rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 3 hdc. *Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog. Join with sl st to first hdc. 40 sts.
Next rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 2 hdc. *Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog. Join with sl st to first hdc. 30 sts. Stuff Maki Roll.
Next rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. *Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog. Join with sl st to first hdc. 20 sts.
Next rnd: Ch 2. (Hdc2tog) 10 times. Join with sl st to first hdc. 10 sts.
Fasten off leaving a long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts and fasten securely.

Avocado (make 2)
With E, ch 8.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 7 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 5 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 3 sc.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row.
Fasten off.

Salmon (make 2)
With C, ch 6.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 5 sc.
2nd to 4th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Fasten off.

Carrot (make 2)
With D, ch 3.
1st row: 5 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Sew 1 each of Avocado, Salmon, and Carrot to top and bottom of Maki Roll. With A, embroider mouth and eyes as shown in picture.

Shrimp Nigiri
Rice
Note: Turn at end of each rnd to work RS and WS rnds.
With A, ch 6.
1st rnd: (RS). 3 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each of next 2 ch. 6 hdc in last ch. Working into opposite side of foundation ch, 1 hdc in each of next 2 ch. 3 hdc in last ch. Join with sl st to first hdc. Turn. 16 hdc.
2nd rnd: (WS). Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. 3 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 3 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 3 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 3 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. Turn.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 2 hdc. 3 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc. 3 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 3 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc. 3 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. Turn.
4th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 3 hdc. 3 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 8 hdc. 3 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc. 3 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 8 hdc. 3 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. Turn.
5th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 4 hdc. 3 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 10 hdc. 3 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 8 hdc. 3 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 10 hdc. 3 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. Turn.
6th rnd: Ch 2. Working in front loops only, 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. Turn.
7th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. Turn.
Rep last rnd until work from 6th rnd measures approx 5½" [14 cm], ending on a RS rnd.
Next rnd: (WS). Ch 2. Working in front loops only, 1 hdc in each of first 4 hdc. Hdc3tog. 1 hdc in each of next 10 hdc. Hdc3tog. 1 hdc in each of next 8 hdc. Hdc3tog. 1 hdc in each of next 10 hdc. Hdc3tog. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. Turn.
Next rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 2 hdc. Hdc3tog. 1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc. Hdc3tog. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. Hdc3tog. 1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc. Hdc3tog. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. Turn.
Next rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. Hdc3tog. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. Hdc3tog. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Hdc3tog. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. Hdc3tog. 1 hdc in next hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. Turn.
Next rnd: Ch 2. Hdc3tog. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. (Hdc3tog) twice. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Hdc3tog. Join with sl st to first hdc. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts and fasten securely.

Shrimp
With C, ch 2.
1st rnd: 10 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 10 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 20 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last st. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 30 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * to last st. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 40 sc.
5th and 6th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Do not break C. Join A.
8th and 9th rnds: With A, ch 2. 1 hdc in first sc. 1 hdc in each of next 17 sc. 1 sc in next sc. 1 sl st in each of next 2 sc. 1 sc in next sc. 1 hdc in each of next 18 sc. Join with sl st to first hdc.
10th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first st. 1 hdc in each of next 17 sts. 1 sc in next st. 1 sl st in each of next 2 sts. 1 sc in next st. 1 hdc in each of next 18 sts. Join with sl st to first hdc. Do not break A, Join C.
11th and 12th rnds: With C, ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
13th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. Do not break C. Join A.
14th and 15th rnds: With A, ch 2. 1 hdc in each st around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
16th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st around. Join with sl st to first hdc. Do not break A, Join C.
Rep 11th to 16th rnds once more. Break A.
Next 3 rnds: With C, ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Join with sl st to first sc. 30 sts.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Join with sl st to first sc. 20 sts.
Next 2 rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 10 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 10 sts.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

With A, embroider line down center of Shrimp.

Tail (make 2).
With C, ch 10.
1st rnd: 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each of next 6 ch. 6 hdc in last ch. Working into opposite side of foundation chain, 1 hdc in each of next 7 ch. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Sew Tail to end of Shrimp. With A, chain stitch through both thicknesses down center of Shrimp. Sew Shrimp to Rice as shown in picture. With B, embroider face on Shrimp Nigiri as shown in picture.

Hand Roll
With B, ch 3.
1st rnd: 4 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first hdc. 4 hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 8 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 4th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last st. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 12 hdc.
5th rnd: As 3rd rnd.
6th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 2 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Rep from * to last st. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 16 hdc.
7th rnd: As 3rd rnd.
8th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 3 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Rep from * to last st. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 20 hdc.
9th rnd: As 3rd rnd.
10th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 4 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. Rep from * to last st. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 24 hdc.
11th rnd: As 3rd rnd.
12th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 5 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. Rep from * to last st. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 28 hdc.
13th rnd: As 3rd rnd.
14th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 6 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc. Rep from * to last st. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 32 hdc.
15th rnd: As 3rd rnd.
16th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 7 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 7 hdc. Rep from * to last st. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 36 hdc.
17th rnd: As 3rd rnd.
18th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 8 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 8 hdc. Rep from * to last st. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 40 hdc.
19th rnd: As 3rd rnd.
20th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 9 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 9 hdc. Rep from * to last st. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 44 hdc.
21st rnd: As 3rd rnd.
22nd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 10 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 10 hdc. Rep from * to last st. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 48 hdc.
Break B.
23rd rnd: Join A. With A, ch 2. Working in back loops only, 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
24th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 10 hdc. *Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 10 hdc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog. Join with sl st to first hdc. 44 sts.
25th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 9 hdc. *Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 9 hdc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog. Join with sl st to first hdc. 40 sts.
26th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 2 hdc. *Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Rep from * to last 2 hdc. Hdc2tog. Join with sl st to first hdc. 30 sts. Stuff Hand Roll.
25th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. *Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog. Join with sl st to first hdc. 20 sts.
26th rnd: Ch 2. (Hdc2tog) 10 times. Join with sl st to first hdc. 10 sts.
Fasten off leaving a long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts and fasten securely.

Cucumber
With E, ch 10.

Size U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops.
measurements: Approx 46” [117 cm] long x 3” [7.5 cm] wide.
gauge: 20 sts and 21 rows = 4” [10 cm] in sc/ch-1 (Moss st) pat.
instructions:
Ch 2. (See Diagram on page 2).
1st row: (RS). 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Turn. 3 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 4 sts - 3 sc and 1 ch-1 sp.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 5 sts – 4 sc and 1 ch-1 sp.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
7th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in last sc. 6 sts – 4 sc and 2 ch-1 sps.
8th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
9th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 7 sts – 5 sc and 2 ch-1 sps.
10th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) twice. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
11th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last ch-1 sp and sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 8 sts – 5 sc and 3 ch-1 sps.
12th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
13th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 9 sts – 6 sc and 3 ch-1 sps.
14th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
Rep last 4 rows twice more, inc 1 st at end of every RS row. 13 sts at end of last row. Place marker on last row on RS of work.
Work even in Moss St Pat as follows:
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last ch-1 sp and sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows for Moss St Pat until work from marked row measures 41” [104 cm], ending on a WS.
Beg Dec’s:
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 12 sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last 3 sts. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Sc2tog. Turn. 11 sts.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
Rep last 4 rows 3 times more to 5 sts, then rep 1st and 2nd rows once more. 4 sts.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Sc2tog. Turn. 3 sts.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Turn.
Next row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. Sc2tog. Turn. 2 sts.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Fasten off.
Weave in ends.
